cards.name: Planeswalker's Mischief
cards.text: {3}{U}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. If it's an instant or sorcery card, exile it. You may cast it without paying its mana cost for as long as it remains exiled. (If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.) At the beginning of the next end step, if you haven't cast it, return it to its owner's hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, then the ability does nothing.
If Planeswalker's Mischief leaves the battlefield, any cards it exiled are still under the effect of the ability and can be cast (and if they are not cast, they are returned to the owner's hand).
When cast, the card goes to its owner's graveyard after it resolves.

cards.originalText: {3}{U}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from his or her hand. If it's an instant or sorcery card, remove it from the game. As long as it remains removed from the game, you may play it as though it were in your hand without paying its mana cost. If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0. At end of turn, if you haven't played it, return it to its owner's hand. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Rushing River
cards.text:
Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. If this spell was kicked, return another target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice a tapped land.
You choose a second target only if you choose to pay the Kicker cost.

cards.originalText:
Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you play this spell.)
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. If you paid the kicker cost, return another target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sea Snidd
cards.text: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It always has the home-turf advantage.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target land's type becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Shifting Sky
cards.text:
As Shifting Sky enters the battlefield, choose a color.
All nonland permanents are the chosen color.
cards.flavor:
Master the sky and you rule everything beneath it.
—Metathran saying
cards.originalText:
As Shifting Sky comes into play, choose a color.
All nonland permanents are the chosen color.

cards.name: Sisay's Ingenuity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Sisay's Ingenuity enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has "{2}{U}: Target creature becomes the color of your choice until end of turn."
cards.originalText:
When Sisay's Ingenuity comes into play, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has "{2}{U}: Target creature becomes the color of your choice until end of turn."

cards.name: Sleeping Potion
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Sleeping Potion enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice Sleeping Potion.
cards.originalText:
When Sleeping Potion comes into play, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice Sleeping Potion.

cards.name: Stormscape Battlemage
cards.text:
Kicker {W} and/or {2}{B} (You may pay an additional {W} and/or {2}{B} as you cast this spell.)
When Stormscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {W} kicker, you gain 3 life.
When Stormscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{B} kicker, destroy target nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Stormscape Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
White spells and black spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: Each Stormscape apprentice must hand-raise and train an owl before attaining the rank of master.

rulings.text: If a spell is both white and black, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText:
Flying
White spells and black spells you play cost {1} less to play.

cards.name: Sunken Hope
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a creature they control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: While Dominarians fought for their world, Rath stole it from under their feet.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a creature he or she controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Waterspout Elemental
cards.text:
Kicker {U} (You may pay an additional {U} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Waterspout Elemental enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, return all other creatures to their owners' hands and you skip your next turn.

rulings.text: It affects your creatures as well as your opponent's.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {U} (You may pay an additional {U} as you play this spell.)
Flying
When Waterspout Elemental comes into play, if you paid the kicker cost, return all other creatures to their owners' hands and you skip your next turn.

cards.name: Bog Down
cards.text:
Kicker—Sacrifice two lands. (You may sacrifice two lands in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Target player discards two cards. If this spell was kicked, that player discards three cards instead.

rulings.text: The player discards 2 cards or 3 cards, not 5 cards.

cards.originalText:
Kicker—Sacrifice two lands. (You may sacrifice two lands in addition to any other costs as you play this spell.)
Target player discards two cards from his or her hand. If you paid the kicker cost, that player discards three cards from his or her hand instead.

cards.name: Dark Suspicions
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player loses X life, where X is the number of cards in that player's hand minus the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor:
"After four thousand years, you learn to plan for betrayal."
—Urza
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player loses 1 life for each card in his or her hand more than you have in your hand.

cards.name: Death Bomb
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller loses 2 life.
cards.flavor: There's no higher honor in Phyrexia than dying for Yawgmoth's glorious vision.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Death Bomb, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller loses 2 life.

cards.name: Diabolic Intent
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You must choose a card if there are any in your library.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Diabolic Intent, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Exotic Disease
cards.text: Domain — Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"Do not fear death. I shall release you from the eternal bonds and bring you glory."
—Lord Dralnu

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

cards.name: Lord of the Undead
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"
—Lord Dralnu

rulings.text: Lord of the Undead now has the Zombie creature type and its first ability has been reworded to affect *other* Zombies. This means that if two Lord of the Undead are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.originalText:
All Zombies get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Maggot Carrier
cards.text: When Maggot Carrier enters the battlefield, each player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"The mere sight of our undead allies sickens me. What unholy bargain have you struck?"
—Grizzlegom, to Agnate
cards.originalText: When Maggot Carrier comes into play, each player loses 1 life.

cards.name: Morgue Toad
cards.text: Sacrifice Morgue Toad: Add {U}{R}.
cards.flavor:
"The toads of Urborg aren't fast, powerful, or pleasant, but they have their uses."
—Ertai
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Morgue Toad: Add {U}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Nightscape Battlemage
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{U} and/or {2}{R} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} and/or {2}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Nightscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{U} kicker, return up to two target nonblack creatures to their owners' hands.
When Nightscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{R} kicker, destroy target land.

cards.name: Nightscape Familiar
cards.text:
Blue spells and red spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Nightscape Familiar.
cards.flavor: Nightscape masters don't stop at raising the spirit of a fallen battlemage. They raise the flesh along with it.

rulings.text: If a spell is both blue and red, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText:
Blue spells and red spells you play cost {1} less to play.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Nightscape Familiar.

cards.name: Noxious Vapors
cards.text: Each player reveals their hand, chooses one card of each color from it, then discards all other nonland cards.
cards.flavor: Urborg would just as soon steal your memories as your life.
cards.originalText: Each player reveals his or her hand and chooses one card of each color from it, then discards all other nonland cards from it.

cards.name: Phyrexian Bloodstock
cards.text: When Phyrexian Bloodstock leaves the battlefield, destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: It reeks of terror and chaos.
cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Bloodstock leaves play, destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Phyrexian Scuta
cards.text:
Kicker—Pay 3 life. (You may pay 3 life in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
If Phyrexian Scuta was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.originalText:
Kicker—Pay 3 life. (You may pay 3 life in addition to any other costs as you play this spell.)
If you paid the kicker cost, Phyrexian Scuta comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Planeswalker's Scorn
cards.text: {3}{B}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the revealed card's converted mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, then X is zero.

cards.originalText: {3}{B}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from his or her hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the revealed card's converted mana cost. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Shriek of Dread
cards.text: Target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: When Crosis roared, the battle ended and the slaughter began.
cards.originalText: Target creature can't be blocked this turn except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.

cards.name: Sinister Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1 and is black.
cards.flavor:
"I bless the living with a song of death."
—Lord Dralnu
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +3/+1 and is black.

cards.name: Slay
cards.text:
Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The elves had the edge in guile, skill, and valor. But in the end, only sheer numbers mattered.

rulings.text: You don't draw a card if this spell is countered.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Volcano Imp
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Volcano Imp gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Its claws cut faster than a flame flickers.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{R}: Volcano Imp gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Warped Devotion
cards.text: Whenever a permanent is returned to a player's hand, that player discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"Before the glory of Yawgmoth, yes, even this makes sense."
—Urza, to Gerrard

rulings.text: This card can trigger on itself being returned to a player's hand.

cards.originalText: Whenever a permanent is returned to a player's hand, that player discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Caldera Kavu
cards.text:
{1}{B}: Caldera Kavu gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{G}: Caldera Kavu becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: As powerful and malleable as the molten rock it calls home.

rulings.text: You choose a color on resolution.

cards.originalText:
{1}{B}: Caldera Kavu gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{G}: Caldera Kavu becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Deadapult
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice a Zombie: Deadapult deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Nothing ruins your day like a blazing zombie."
—Tahngarth
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice a Zombie: Deadapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Flametongue Kavu
cards.text: When Flametongue Kavu enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
"For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim."
—Sisay

rulings.text: If it enters the battlefield as the only targetable creature, it must target itself.

cards.originalText: When Flametongue Kavu comes into play, it deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Goblin Game
cards.text: Each player hides at least one item, then all players reveal them simultaneously. Each player loses life equal to the number of items they revealed. The player who revealed the fewest items then loses half their life, rounded up. If two or more players are tied for fewest, each loses half their life, rounded up.

rulings.text: When it comes to choice of items, use common sense. Items should be small enough to hide but large enough to count. Make it clear what kind of object you are hiding beforehand. For example, one player may choose coins and the other may choose dice. If you can't find something convenient to hide, write numbers on a piece of paper and reveal the numbers. Make sure the numbers are unambiguous (for example, underline a 6 or 9 so it can't be misread).
If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

cards.originalText: Each player hides at least one object, then all players reveal them simultaneously. Each player loses life equal to the number of objects he or she revealed. The player who revealed the fewest objects then loses half his or her life, rounded up. If two or more players are tied for fewest, each loses half his or her life, rounded up.

cards.name: Implode
cards.text:
Destroy target land.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: To save Dominaria, nine planeswalkers sought the annihilation of Phyrexia itself.
cards.originalText:
Destroy target land.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Insolence
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Insolence deals 2 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor:
"Sacrificing mortal dragons to satisfy your immortal hunger ends here."
—Darigaaz, to Rith

rulings.text: The damaging ability triggers no matter how the creature becomes tapped.
It does not trigger immediately when cast targeting an already tapped creature.

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Insolence deals 2 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Kavu Recluse
cards.text: {T}: Target land becomes a Forest until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Few ever see this particular breed of kavu, which hides in forests of its own making.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target land becomes a forest until end of turn.

cards.name: Keldon Mantle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{B}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}: Enchanted creature gains trample until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{B}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}: Enchanted creature gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Magma Burst
cards.text:
Kicker—Sacrifice two lands. (You may sacrifice two lands in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Magma Burst deals 3 damage to any target. If this spell was kicked, it deals 3 damage to another target.

rulings.text: The second target must be different from the first one.
You choose a second target only if you choose to pay the Kicker cost.

cards.originalText:
Kicker—Sacrifice two lands. (You may sacrifice two lands in addition to any other costs as you play this spell.)
Magma Burst deals 3 damage to target creature or player. If you paid the kicker cost, Magma Burst deals 3 damage to another target creature or player.

cards.name: Mire Kavu
cards.text: Mire Kavu gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.
cards.flavor: "At this rate," said Sisay, "the next kavu we see will have wings."
cards.originalText: Mire Kavu gets +1/+1 as long as you control a swamp.

cards.name: Mogg Jailer
cards.text: Mogg Jailer can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 2 or less.
cards.flavor:
Hey, wake up
—Mogg secret password
cards.originalText: Mogg Jailer can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 2 or less.

cards.name: Mogg Sentry
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Nobody stands in one place better than a mogg."
—Tahngarth
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Planeswalker's Fury
cards.text: {3}{R}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. Planeswalker's Fury deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that player. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, then no damage is dealt.

cards.originalText: {3}{R}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from his or her hand. Planeswalker's Fury deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that player. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Singe
cards.text: Singe deals 1 damage to target creature. That creature becomes black until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Burnt flesh. Blackened soul.
cards.originalText: Singe deals 1 damage to target creature. That creature becomes black until end of turn.

cards.name: Slingshot Goblin
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Slingshot Goblin deals 2 damage to target blue creature.
cards.flavor: It's most effective when it doesn't eat the ammunition.
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Slingshot Goblin deals 2 damage to target blue creature.

cards.name: Strafe
cards.text: Strafe deals 3 damage to target nonred creature.
cards.flavor:
"All right, let's light 'em up"
—Gerrard
cards.originalText: Strafe deals 3 damage to target nonred creature.

cards.text:
Vigilance
{1}{R}, {T}: Tahngarth, Talruum Hero deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Tahngarth.
cards.originalText:
Attacking doesn't cause Tahngarth, Talruum Hero to tap.
{1}{R}, {T}: Tahngarth deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Tahngarth.

When Thunderscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {1}{B} kicker, target player discards two cards.
When Thunderscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {G} kicker, destroy target enchantment.

First strike
Black spells and green spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

rulings.text: If a spell is both black and green, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.

cards.name: Amphibious Kavu

cards.flavor: Merfolk raided the shores untroubled for years . . . until the shores started fighting back.

rulings.text: The ability only triggers once per combat.

cards.originalText: Whenever Amphibious Kavu blocks or becomes blocked by one or more blue and/or black creatures, Amphibious Kavu gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Falling Timber
cards.text:
Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn. If this spell was kicked, prevent all combat damage another target creature would deal this turn.

rulings.text: You pick a second target only if you choose to kick Falling Timber.

cards.originalText:
Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you play this spell.)
Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn. If you paid the kicker cost, prevent all combat damage another target creature would deal this turn.

cards.name: Gaea's Herald
cards.text: Creature spells can't be countered.
cards.flavor: "I bring word from Gaea. Fight on! She will never allow her children to die alone."

rulings.text: The ability applies to your opponent's spells as well as your own.

cards.originalText: Creature spells can't be countered by spells or abilities.

cards.name: Gaea's Might
cards.text: Domain — Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor: With the Heart of Yavimaya aiding him, Multani didn't even strain at the load.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Magnigoth Treefolk
cards.text: Domain — For each basic land type among lands you control, Magnigoth Treefolk has landwalk of that type. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of that type.)

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: For each basic land type among lands you control, Magnigoth Treefolk has landwalk of that type. (It's unblockable as long as defending player controls a land of that type.)

cards.name: Mirrorwood Treefolk
cards.text: {2}{R}{W}: The next time damage would be dealt to Mirrorwood Treefolk this turn, that damage is dealt to any target instead.
cards.flavor: It doesn't need a bite. The bark works just fine.

rulings.text: If the target creature is not on the battlefield (or is not a creature) at the time the damage would be redirected, then the damage goes on this card.

The ability applies to the next time damage is dealt. Normally this means damage from one source at one time, but during combat it is possible for multiple sources to damage the Treefolk at one time, in which case damage from all of those sources is redirected.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}{W}: The next time damage would be dealt to Mirrorwood Treefolk this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature or player instead.

cards.name: Multani's Harmony
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
cards.flavor: "Welcome to paradise."
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Nemata, Grove Guardian
cards.text:
{2}{G}: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Saproling creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{2}{G}: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.
Sacrifice a Saproling: All Saprolings get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Planeswalker's Favor
cards.text: {3}{G}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the revealed card's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: Freyalise strengthens her faithful.

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, then X is zero.

cards.originalText: {3}{G}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from his or her hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the revealed card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Primal Growth
cards.text:
Kicker—Sacrifice a creature. (You may sacrifice a creature in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. If this spell was kicked, instead search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You may choose not to find any basic lands when you search.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Kicker—Sacrifice a creature. (You may sacrifice a creature in addition to any other costs as you play this spell.) 
Search your library for a basic land card, put that card into play, then shuffle your library. If you paid the kicker cost, instead search your library for two basic land cards, put them into play, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Pygmy Kavu
cards.text: When Pygmy Kavu enters the battlefield, draw a card for each black creature your opponents control.
cards.flavor:
"We could learn a lot by watching the little ones," said Agnate.
"Define 'little,'" replied Grizzlegom.
cards.originalText: When Pygmy Kavu comes into play, draw a card for each black creature your opponents control.

cards.name: Quirion Dryad
cards.text: Whenever you cast a white, blue, black, or red spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Quirion Dryad.
cards.flavor:
"Never underestimate the ability of natural forces to adapt to unnatural influences."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: Quirion Dryad's ability will trigger only once per spell you cast, as long as that spell is at least one of the listed colors.
Quirion Dryad's ability will trigger if you cast a spell that's green and at least one of the listed colors.

cards.originalText: Whenever you play a white, blue, black, or red spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Quirion Dryad.

cards.name: Quirion Explorer
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
cards.flavor:
Fight with a friend at your back, steel in your hands, and magic in your veins.
—Quirion creed

rulings.text: If the opponent only has lands that produce colorless or no mana, this card's ability can still be activated; it just won't produce any mana.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

cards.name: Root Greevil
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Root Greevil: Destroy all enchantments of the color of your choice.
cards.flavor: The root of all greevils.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Root Greevil: Destroy all enchantments of the color of your choice.

cards.name: Skyshroud Blessing
cards.text:
All lands gain shroud until end of turn. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Behold," said Freyalise to Eladamri. "Your Skyshroud home has followed you to Dominaria."

rulings.text: This affects your lands and your opponent's.

cards.originalText:
Lands can't be the targets of spells or abilities this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Stone Kavu
cards.text:
{R}: Stone Kavu gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{W}: Stone Kavu gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: To maintain its hide, it consumes a variety of rocks—not to mention a variety of Phyrexians.
cards.originalText:
{R}: Stone Kavu gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{W}: Stone Kavu gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Thornscape Battlemage
cards.text:
Kicker {R} and/or {W} (You may pay an additional {R} and/or {W} as you cast this spell.)
When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {R} kicker, it deals 2 damage to any target.
When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {W} kicker, destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: You choose whether to kick a spell as you cast it, and you pay that much along with the spell's mana cost at the same time. Kicking a spell is always optional.
You can pay any particular kicker cost only once. You can't pay it multiple times to get multiples of either triggered ability.
If Thornscape Battlemage is put onto the battlefield as the result of a spell or ability, there's no opportunity to kick it.
Kicker costs don't change a spell's mana cost or converted mana cost.

cards.name: Thornscape Familiar
cards.text: Red spells and white spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: Blessed with many options, Thornscape masters favor scarabs as familiars.

rulings.text: If a spell is both red and white, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText: Red spells and white spells you play cost {1} less to play.

cards.name: Ancient Spider
cards.text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It outlived both king and castle.
cards.originalText:
First strike
Ancient Spider may block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Cavern Harpy
cards.text:
Flying
When Cavern Harpy enters the battlefield, return a blue or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
Pay 1 life: Return Cavern Harpy to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Cavern Harpy comes into play, return a blue or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
Pay 1 life: Return Cavern Harpy to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Cloud Cover
cards.text: Whenever another permanent you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, you may return that permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Whenever another permanent you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, you may return that permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Crosis's Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
• Destroy target artifact.
cards.originalText: Choose one Return target permanent to its owner's hand; or destroy target nonblack creature, and it can't be regenerated; or destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Darigaaz's Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Darigaaz's Charm deals 3 damage to any target.
• Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand; or Darigaaz's Charm deals 3 damage to target creature or player; or target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Daring Leap
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying and first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Most warriors think in only two dimensions. Agnate and his metathran brethren were trained to battle in three.

rulings.text: If used after a blocker is assigned your creature is still blocked.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying and first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Destructive Flow
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a nonbasic land.
cards.flavor: Stage two of the Phyrexian invasion included the complete alteration of Dominaria's landscape.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a nonbasic land.

cards.name: Doomsday Specter
cards.text:
Flying
When Doomsday Specter enters the battlefield, return a blue or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
Whenever Doomsday Specter deals combat damage to a player, look at that player's hand and choose a card from it. The player discards that card.

rulings.text: You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Doomsday Specter comes into play, return a blue or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
Whenever Doomsday Specter deals combat damage to a player, look at that player's hand and choose a card from it. The player discards that card.

cards.name: Dralnu's Crusade
cards.text:
Goblin creatures get +1/+1.
All Goblins are black and are Zombies in addition to their other creature types.
cards.flavor:
"Don't you agree that mogg intellects are improved by zombification?"
—Lord Dralnu

rulings.text: The Goblins are both Goblins and Zombies and they are black (they lose their previous color(s)).
This only affects Goblins which are on the battlefield. Ones in your graveyard, library, etc. are not changed to be black or to be Zombies.

cards.originalText: All Goblins get +1/+1, are black, and are Zombies in addition to their creature types.

cards.name: Dromar's Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• You gain 5 life.
• Counter target spell.
• Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one You gain 5 life; or counter target spell; or target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Eladamri's Call
cards.text: Search your library for a creature card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Tribal rivalries and petty disputes were laid aside at Eladamri's summons.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a creature card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ertai, the Corrupted
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature or enchantment: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: Altered by Phyrexian science, corrupted by black mana, and twisted by rage, Ertai still looked in the mirror and saw only glory.

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

cards.originalText: {U}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature or enchantment: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Fleetfoot Panther
cards.text:
Flash
When Fleetfoot Panther enters the battlefield, return a green or white creature you control to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText:
You may play Fleetfoot Panther any time you could play an instant.
When Fleetfoot Panther comes into play, return a green or white creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Gerrard's Command
cards.text: Untap target creature. It gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Unless you like the idea of becoming some goblin's lunch, get up and move!"

rulings.text: This can target a creature which is already untapped.

cards.originalText: Untap target creature. It gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Horned Kavu
cards.text: When Horned Kavu enters the battlefield, return a red or green creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "That didn't happen naturally," said Multani. "Rath's overlay is interfering with the Æther itself."

rulings.text: You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText: When Horned Kavu comes into play, return a red or green creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Hull Breach
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Destroy target artifact and target enchantment.
cards.flavor: "Crovax knows we're coming now," said a grinning Sisay. "I just sent the Predator crashing into his stronghold."
cards.originalText: Choose one Destroy target artifact; or destroy target enchantment; or destroy target artifact and target enchantment.

cards.name: Keldon Twilight
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if no creatures attacked this turn, that player sacrifices a creature they controlled since the beginning of the turn.
cards.originalText: At the end of each player's turn, if no creatures attacked that turn, that player sacrifices a creature he or she controlled since the beginning of the turn.

cards.name: Lava Zombie
cards.text:
When Lava Zombie enters the battlefield, return a black or red creature you control to its owner's hand.
{2}: Lava Zombie gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText:
When Lava Zombie comes into play, return a black or red creature you control to its owner's hand.
{2}: Lava Zombie gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Malicious Advice
cards.text: Tap X target artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. You lose X life.
cards.flavor:
"Rule through fear, Darigaaz. Only if the dragons feel terror will they truly be your servants."
—Tevesh Szat
cards.originalText: Tap X target artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. You lose X life.

cards.name: Marsh Crocodile
cards.text:
When Marsh Crocodile enters the battlefield, return a blue or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Marsh Crocodile enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.

rulings.text: Both triggered abilities trigger at the same time so you can decide which order they go on the stack.
This card can return itself to your hand.
You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText:
When Marsh Crocodile comes into play, return a blue or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Marsh Crocodile comes into play, each player discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Meddling Mage
cards.text:
As Meddling Mage enters the battlefield, choose a nonland card name.
Spells with the chosen name can't be cast.
cards.flavor: Meddling mages chant so loudly that no one can get a spell in edgewise.

rulings.text: No one can cast spells or activate abilities between the time a card is named and the time that Meddling Mage's ability starts to work.
Spells with the chosen name that somehow happen to already be on the stack when Meddling Mage enters the battlefield are not affected by Meddling Mage's ability.
Although the named card can't be cast, it can still be put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability (if it's a permanent card).
You can name either half of a split card, but not both. If you do so, that half (and both halves, if the split card has fuse) can't be cast. The other half is unaffected.
If a card with morph is named, that card may still be cast face down. Face-down cards have no names.
Once Meddling Mage leaves the battlefield, the named card can be cast again.

cards.originalText:
As Meddling Mage comes into play, name a nonland card.
The named card can't be played.

cards.name: Natural Emergence
cards.text:
When Natural Emergence enters the battlefield, return a red or green enchantment you control to its owner's hand.
Lands you control are 2/2 creatures with first strike. They're still lands.

rulings.text: You choose the enchantment to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn.

cards.originalText:
When Natural Emergence comes into play, return a red or green enchantment you control to its owner's hand.
Lands you control are 2/2 creatures with first strike. They're still lands.

cards.name: Phyrexian Tyranny
cards.text: Whenever a player draws a card, that player loses 2 life unless they pay {2}.
cards.flavor:
"He is Yawgmoth's reward to me. I shall kill him a hundred times a day."
—Crovax, to Ertai

rulings.text: If more than one card is drawn at a time, this triggers for each card drawn.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player draws a card, that player loses 2 life unless he or she pays {2}.

cards.name: Questing Phelddagrif
cards.text:
{G}: Questing Phelddagrif gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Target opponent creates a 1/1 green Hippo creature token.
{W}: Questing Phelddagrif gains protection from black and from red until end of turn. Target opponent gains 2 life.
{U}: Questing Phelddagrif gains flying until end of turn. Target opponent may draw a card.
cards.originalText:
{G}: Questing Phelddagrif gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Target opponent puts a 1/1 green Hippo creature token into play.
{W}: Questing Phelddagrif gains protection from black and from red until end of turn. Target opponent gains 2 life.
{U}: Questing Phelddagrif gains flying until end of turn. Target opponent may draw a card.

cards.name: Radiant Kavu
cards.text: {R}{G}{W}: Prevent all combat damage blue creatures and black creatures would deal this turn.
cards.flavor: When angered or frightened, it protects itself with a burst of blinding light.
cards.originalText: {R}{G}{W}: Prevent all combat damage blue creatures and black creatures would deal this turn.

cards.name: Razing Snidd
cards.text:
When Razing Snidd enters the battlefield, return a black or red creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Razing Snidd enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a land.

rulings.text: It probably won't matter much, but you choose the order in which the two triggered abilities are placed on the stack.
You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText:
When Razing Snidd comes into play, return a black or red creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Razing Snidd comes into play, each player sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Rith's Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target nonbasic land.
• Create three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
• Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one Destroy target nonbasic land; or put three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens into play; or prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.

cards.name: Sawtooth Loon
cards.text:
Flying
When Sawtooth Loon enters the battlefield, return a white or blue creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Sawtooth Loon enters the battlefield, draw two cards, then put two cards from your hand on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: Both triggered abilities trigger at the same time so you can decide which order they go on the stack. If you have no cards in hand, you would likely choose the order where you draw and put on the library before unsummoning the creature that is on the battlefield.
You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sawtooth Loon comes into play, return a white or blue creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Sawtooth Loon comes into play, draw two cards, then put two cards from your hand on the bottom of your library.

Trample
When Shivan Wurm comes into play, return a red or green creature you control to its owner's hand.

Flying

cards.name: Sparkcaster

When Sparkcaster enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.

rulings.text: It probably won't matter much, but you choose the order in which the two triggered abilities are placed on the stack.
You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText:
When Sparkcaster comes into play, return a red or green creature you control to its owner's hand.

First strike
When Steel Leaf Paladin enters the battlefield, return a green or white creature you control to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

First strike
When Steel Leaf Paladin comes into play, return a green or white creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Terminate
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Like his mother before him, Darigaaz gave his life defending Dominaria from the tyranny of self-styled "gods."
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
